events.name: 5th Psychology Days
events.description:
Hello everyone! We are here with the 5th edition of the Psychology Days. Our event will be held on May 16-17 at the Yeditepe University Faculty of Fine Arts Conference Hall. We have prepared a full program with expert speakers, various workshops, and stands in our foyer area. The event is open to everyone, and participation certificates will be given to participants. Shuttle service from Kozyatağı metro to the campus will be provided, and there will be refreshments. Relevant details are included in our form, and you can select the options that suit you.

Notes:

- Workshops within the event are limited in capacity.

- It is possible to participate only in the speech sessions without attending the workshops. Participants who wish to attend the workshops must select the workshop they want to join.

- Our event is paid, and the fees are as follows.

Participation fee for all speeches over two days = 100₺

Participation fee for all speeches over two days plus one workshop = 150₺

events.name: 7th Psychology Days: After Yesterday Before Tomorrow: Does Hope End?
events.description:
Istanbul Aydın University Psychology Club, in collaboration with Marmara Psychology, presents the 7th Psychology Days with the theme 'After Yesterday Before Tomorrow: Does Hope End?' on May 17-18. Don't forget to reserve your place for this symposium, which will feature valuable speakers over two days!

A 'Certificate of Participation' will be given to those who attend the symposium fully. Seating is limited!

Note: A 10% discount will be applied to all our training programs for participants of the symposium.

events.name: II. Brain and Behavior Symposium
events.description: Hello everyone! We are delighted to share with you the second edition of the Brain and Behavior Symposium, following the first one we held last year. We owe a debt of gratitude to those who contributed to our event. Our symposium is open to everyone.

events.description:

events.name: 90's and 2000's Party
events.description:
Dear TPÖÇG members!
Let's hop on a time machine and return to the fun atmosphere of the 90's and 2000's. Pack your bag with childhood memories and get ready for a night full of music.

🕣20.30

📌Participation is limited.

events.name: Mental Training and Visualization in Sports
events.description:

events.name: Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder
events.description:
Hello from the IGU Psychology Club Academic Events Team!

Although ADHD is more common in children, it is a type of neurological disorder that also makes daily life difficult for adults and is commonly known as hyperactivity. Various factors such as environmental, genetic, and brain structure can be the source of this disorder.

We invite you to our event where we will try to understand ADHD with the explanation of Psychologist Elif Berfin Beyhan.

🗓️Date: May 23, Thursday
⏱️Time: 14:00
📍Venue: J Block 311

events.name: Audio Description Workshop
events.eventHost: TPÖÇG Istanbul Local Organization Social Responsibility Team
events.description:
Warm greetings from the Istanbul Local Organization Social Responsibility Team! 💐

In collaboration with 'My Classmate', we are hosting an exciting event to raise awareness in society and increase social interaction! 🌟

In the Audio Description Workshop, which will be held on Saturday, May 24, at 14.00 at MEF University, we offer the chance for visually impaired individuals to explore the world through sounds. In this special event, guided by Specialist Psychologist Fatma İzel Şahin from the Parıltı Support Association for the Blind Children, we aim to provide a comprehensive experience to our participants and increase social awareness.

Don't miss this meaningful event, join us, and let's create a transformation together! 🎙️💫

📍MEF University | MEFTEK
🗓️May 24, Friday
⏰14.00

📍Participation is limited.

events.name: Clinical Psychology Day
events.description:

Our event will be held on Saturday, May 25, at the Physics U2 amphitheater. The application form will open on Friday, May 10, at 20.00.

events.name: Istanbul Spring Education Days 'Dasein'
events.description:
Dasein, meaning existence. The term was introduced to the public with Heidegger's book 'Being and Time'. In his philosophy, Dasein has existed in a certain way. It is the mode of existence of human individuals. Perhaps you too have found yourself questioning your life, your goals, yourself, the geography you live in, or your relationships from time to time. What is the meaning of all this, who am I, why do all these people behave this way, what am I doing here? Perhaps, at the most fundamental level, you are searching for the meaning of your existence in the infinite universe; you are not alone. We invite you to Dasein to ask all these questions and more together and search for their answers with your whole existence. Will you join us?

Non-formal Education Trainers
Betül Şimşek
Büşranur Portakal
Ezgi Kılıç
İrem Özden

Trainings to be provided

Eigenwelt: The part of existence that belongs to my self. What have you filled the concept of 'I' with, what adjectives have you used, or have you left it empty, sometimes not even wanting to approach it? No matter what, you define yourself best.

Mitwelt: Everything about being close to someone else, establishing relationships, positioning oneself in that relationship, or conflict; essentially everything related to relating.

Umwelt: You are in contact with everything, and everything is in contact with you. What is everything? Look up and around you; everything you think affects you, even what you are not aware of.

Uberwelt: Just as the universe consists of thousands of parts, does our existence also consist of parts? Which part suits me, which one do I not want? Am I looking for perfection?

🗓Date: May 25-26, 2024
📍Venue: Kaira Psychology / Bakırköy
📌Saturday hours: 10.00-18.00
📌Sunday hours: 10.00-18.00
📌Participation is limited.
📌Fee: 140 TL
(The fee is for two days. Payment details will be provided in the confirmation email. The fee includes venue and stationery costs.)
📌LAST APPLICATION DATE: Wednesday, May 22, 21.00
📌Our event is exclusively for psychology students.

events.name: Working with Children on Trauma
events.description: The last of the four-part online training series organized by Clinical Psychologist Selin Anahar on 'Working with Children on Trauma' will be held on May 30 at 19.00.

events.name: Advanced Counseling Skills
events.description:
We are here with a brand-new program! 🤗

'Advanced Counseling Skills' is an effective program that we have long wanted to share with you, which we believe to be highly transformative for the therapy room and the therapist-client relationship, and will elevate counseling skills to the highest level.

The program, which covers a wide range of topics from the basic principles of psychotherapy to effective communication skills and the process dynamics of therapy, will be conducted by Specialist Clinical Psychologist Ayşegül Kalem, with lectures by world-renowned psychologist Prof. Jeffrey A. Kottler, and guidance from Psychology Istanbul and NEW Psychology experts. During the training, you will develop your advanced counseling skills through a comprehensive manual, practical applications, case examples, and interactive learning.

events.name: Schema Therapy Practitioner Training
events.description:
🗓️ June 1-2, 22-23, 2024
🔸 32 Hours of Online Training
🔸 8 Hours of Online Supervision
🔸 Opportunity to Rewatch Lessons
🔸 University-Approved Certificate Visible on E-Government
🔸 Free Materials
🔸 Limited Quota, High Efficiency Training

✅Schema therapy, developed by Young and colleagues, is an integrative, newer form of therapy that combines elements of cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT), psychoanalysis, attachment theory, and emotion-focused therapy. It aims to treat personality disorders and other psychiatric disorders that do not respond to other treatment options. It is known that characterological problems are difficult to solve with classical cognitive-behavioral therapy. Schema Therapy aims to identify early maladaptive schemas that arise due to unmet basic needs in early childhood and to raise awareness in the patient. In Schema Therapy, treatment approaches mostly progress not through schemas, but through the 'mode concept', which is considered a combination of active schemas and their coping styles.
